quest.name: He Ain't Piggy, He's My Brother
journal: Melodie has information on the mysterious visitor to Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. Is there aught you require? ...Hm? You wish to know about the Xaela man whom I saw? Of course.

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text: His garb was outlandish, not unlike those worn by Alghu and Teleboge, and he seemed to be searching for something. Or someone.

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text: You don't suppose he could be connected to Master Adkiragh in some way?

dialogue.name: TELEBOGE
dialogue.text: Chief! W-We may have a problem!

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text:
(That's him─the visitor!)
...W-Welcome to the Hard Place!

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: (-Adarkim Man-)Beg pardons. I am searching for a man named Adkiragh. If any of you know him, I ask that you point me in his direction.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: (-Adarkim Man-)Well, if it isn't the adventurer from Reunion! The fates are kind to bring us together once more. Lest you have forgotten, you fetched me purbol flowers. Only after we went our separate ways did it occur to me that I had failed to introduce myself. That oversight, I shall now rectify.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: I am Bulugan of the Adarkim, and the man I seek, Adkiragh, is my older brother, whom you may recall has gone into hiding. I had come upon rumors of his whereabouts, and thus did I set out to find him and bring him home.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: These two, I know for minions of Adkiragh, and they likewise vanished from the tribe. I chanced to spot them in Reunion and decided to shadow their steps. They refuse to reveal the truth to me, but I have every reason to believe that I am come to the right place.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Ah, but perhaps it would help if I described my brother.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: First, Adkiragh is a proud man and can oft be heard referring to himself as illustrious.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Next, he is extremely fond of buuz and is skilled in its preparation besides.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Last─and not to insult your intelligence─he is obviously a Xaela like me. This point I emphasize only because there cannot be many of our kind who dwell in these parts.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I haven't seen such a person.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: This piggy here is your brother.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... The Adkiragh I know would not lower himself by dressing as livestock. And yet the man who claims the selfsame name, the proprietor of this establishment, is said to wear a swine's mask.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: You there, take off that mask. I would behold your face.

dialogue.name: MAPOPO
dialogue.text: W-Wait!

dialogue.name: MAPOPO
dialogue.text: The chief, he's...er, disfigured. Yes, disfigured! Hideously so! That's why he wears the mask! He can't bear having his face seen!

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Is that so...? Well, perhaps I misspoke. I am but a stranger here, and it is not my place to make such demands. Very well, I shall take my inquiries to the other residents of this town.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Forename, I must ask a favor. Loath though I am to drag you into my tribe's dilemmas, will you keep an eye on Bulugan?

dialogue.name: TELEBOGE
dialogue.text: My fault? You were there too!

dialogue.name: ALGHU
dialogue.text: It's your fault Bulugan spotted us!

dialogue.name: MAPOPO
dialogue.text: Whatever happens, we must protect the chief!

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text: Something seems to be afoot...though I am not quite sure what. Need I be worried?

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: You are offering to join me? I would be heartened for your company. I am a stranger, and this is a strange land. Yes, very strange indeed...

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: When first I arrived, I thought my eyes were playing tricks. To think that a place exists where man and beastman abide together in peace! I should very much like to meet these creatures you call goblins. Let us begin by speaking with one of them.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Hail to you, friend. I am a wayfarer come far from the east in search of my lost brother. The proprietor of the Hard Place─know you if he is a Xaela like me, and a native of the Azim Steppe?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Slowfix steals a glance at you. Will you gesture something to him?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Shake your head.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Motion to yourself.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Avert your gaze.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Idyllshire is free nation. Birth, race, faith─such things not matter here. One and all are welcome, provided one is willing to sweatwork for good of all.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: And owner of the Hard Place sweatworks muchly. He is highstanding citizen of Idyllshire, has earned highview of gobbieflock. A true gobbiefriend.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: So, Slowfix asks: what business does uplander have with gobbiefriend? Does uplander mean good...or does uplander mean ill?

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text:
W-Well, I wish only to see my brother back to─
...Nay, never mind. My thanks for your time.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Next, I will try approaching the treasure hunters. I understand they have a hand in the running of the settlement. It stands to reason that they would know about its residents.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Midnight Dew looks over at you. Will you gesture something to her?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Shake your head.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Give a knowing wink.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Beg pardons, but I wish to inquire about an Adarkim man named Adkiragh. I believe he is the proprietor of the Hard Place.

dialogue.name: MIDNIGHTDEW
dialogue.text: Adar...kim? Can't say I know what that is, but I do know Adkiragh. We all do.

dialogue.name: MIDNIGHTDEW
dialogue.text: Peculiar choice of outfit aside, he's always got hot meals ready for us hunters after a hard day's work. An' he'll lend an ear to our ventin' till our throats are hoarse.

dialogue.name: MIDNIGHTDEW
dialogue.text: Reckon I speak for all hunters when I say Idyllshire wouldn't be the same without him an' his place. An' that's the Adkiragh I know. I couldn't speak to this Adar-whatsit, though.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: I see you are determined to take my brother's side. I am not blind, my friend. Adkiragh always had a way of winning people over. Growing up, I wished I could be more like him.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Beg pardons, but I wish to inquire about an Adarkim man named Adkiragh. I believe he is the proprietor of the Hard Place.

dialogue.name: MIDNIGHTDEW
dialogue.text: Adar...kim? Can't say I know what that is, but I do know Adkiragh. We all do.

dialogue.name: MIDNIGHTDEW
dialogue.text: Peculiar choice of outfit aside, he's always got hot meals ready for us hunters after a hard day's work. An' he'll lend an ear to our gossipin' an' ventin' till our throats are hoarse.

dialogue.name: MIDNIGHTDEW
dialogue.text: Reckon I speak for all hunters when I say Idyllshire wouldn't be the same without him an' his place. An' that's the Adkiragh I know. I couldn't speak to this Adar-whatsit, though.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: I appreciate your kindness, my friend, but I am not blind. Adkiragh always had a way of winning people over. Growing up, I wished I could be more like him.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: But I am not my brother, nor will I ever be. And there are only so many assassination attempts a man can endure in his sibling's stead.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text:
<sigh> Perhaps a child will prove more forthcoming...
Excuse me, little one. Do you know Adkiragh, the owner of the Hard Place?

dialogue.name: KHLOEALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Uncle Adkiragh? Of course Khloe knows him! He always has exciting stories to share with Khloe and her friends!

dialogue.name: KHLOEALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Lots of people were trying to kill him! Or kidnap him! Or marry him! Sometimes all of these things at once!

dialogue.name: KHLOEALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Oh, and he has a little brother back at home! Someone named Boo...er, Boogaloo! Yes, that's his name! He's very dependable and Uncle Adkiragh admires him very much!

dialogue.name: KHLOEALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Khloe's never met Boogaloo, but Khloe likes him already! Khloe must work hard so Zhloe can admire her like Uncle Adkiragh admires Boogaloo!

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Well, if there was ever any doubt, there is none now. The owner of the Hard Place is Adkiragh, my brother. There is much and more I would say to him. Forename, may I ask you to be present?

dialogue.name: TELEBOGE
dialogue.text: <gulp> H-He's back! What do we do!?

dialogue.name: ALGHU
dialogue.text: Come what may, we stand with the chief!

dialogue.name: MAPOPO
dialogue.text: I'm not letting anyone take the chief away!

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text: Oh, you are returned! Er...should I serve some refreshments?

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: All I have ever wanted was to live my life in peace, away from the burdens of succession. But that was denied to me.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: I felt trapped, deprived of choice. And so I chose nothing. Yet that may be the worst choice of all.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Whether I embrace my fate or seek another path to walk, unless I take control of my own life, it will forever be under another's control. This journey has taught me that.

dialogue.name: BULUGAN
dialogue.text: Your secret is safe with me. I will say that it was not my brother that I found here, but another man. Fare you well.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Wait.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: As I have here, one day you will find your own purpose─something that you will want to protect, no matter the cost. But the road is long, with many a winding turn. Whenever you need a rest on your journey, know that you will always be welcome here.

dialogue.name: MELODIE
dialogue.text: My! To think that Master Adkiragh was once a candidate to lead his tribe!

dialogue.name: MAPOPO
dialogue.text: He's not leaving us! Oh, thank the heavens! <sob>

dialogue.name: TELEBOGE
dialogue.text: It's over! We can finally rest easy!

dialogue.name: ALGHU
dialogue.text: Bulugan is a good man. I wish him well.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: I apologize for the recent uncertainty, but it's safe to say no more of my kinsmen will come after me. The Hard Place need not go without her illustrious proprietor.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: What? I finally reveal my beautiful face, and all you can do is stare? Come now, a compliment or two is surely in order!

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Permit me to thank you again, Forename.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Lest you worry for my brother, you need not.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Bulugan is a born leader. Where I am brazen, he is restrained. Where I am impulsive, he is measured. Often did I wish that I could be more like him.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: He will make a fine khan. And when the day comes, I will go to pay my respects. You should join me─I would show you my homeland.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Of course, my home is here now. And here I shall put down my roots─with an easy heart.

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: But enough talk! We have a business to run!

dialogue.name: ADKIRAGH
dialogue.text: Thanks to your contributions, we are close to being profitable once more. Now, I believe, is a good time to shift our focus to outfitting the place with new furnishings. Go forth, my friend, and procure for us these things!

obj.n: Between a Rock and the Hard Place
